member.name: M:SampSharp.UndergroundMP.UGMP.SetCurrentSeason(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the current in-game season for all connected players. The in-game weather in Bullworth will change to that of the selected season with the in-game clock enabled.
member.param: Use one of the following types:SEASON_DONT_OVERRIDE - Disables the season override. The game will switch back to its internal season when used.SEASON_SUMMERSEASON_AUTUMNSEASON_WINTERSEASON_SPRING

member.name: M:SampSharp.UndergroundMP.UGMP.CreateExtraWeather(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates an additional weather type for all players.
member.param: This parameter tells the game to interpret the data you pass for this weather type as GTA: III weather data, for example. This means you can load timecyc.dat mods made for GTA: III, GTA: VC, Bully, and GTA: SA. See this page for a list of weather handling types.
This parameter tells the game which 'type' of weather this is. See this page for a list of weather base types.

This parameter tells the game which postfx should be used. All 3d era games have their own postfx which uses the weather data you provide. If you want to use GTA: VCS postfx, you can set this parameter to COLOURFILTER_LEEDS and weatherHandlingType to WEATHER_HANDLING_GTAVCS. One important thing to note in this case is that GTA: VCS has two postfx effects (radiosity and blur) while GTA: LCS only uses blur. See this page for a list of colour filters.
member.returns: The extra weather ID. If you wish to use this weather type, add 150 to the extra weather ID when calling SetWeather. If there are no free slots for a new weather type, this function will return -1.

member.summary: Sets (or removes) flags for an extra weather type.
member.param: The extra weather ID which was obtained when calling CreateExtraWeather.
The in-game hour for which this parameter will be used.
The extra weather flag bitfield. See this page for a list of weather type flags.
Self-explainatory.
member.returns: This function will return 1 if successful, or -1 if there is no extra weather ID with the specified type.

member.name: M:SampSharp.UndergroundMP.UGMP.SetExtraWeatherParam_Windyness(System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the windyness for an extra weather type.
member.param: The extra weather ID which was obtained when calling CreateExtraWeather.

The windyness for this weather type. The in-game wind will affect procedural vegetation, tree branch movement, wave height, how the Chinatown banners move, and a lot more. The value really knows no limit. 0.0 means no wind, while 2.0 is used for hurricane weather types. In singleplayer, this column is defined in weather.dat.
member.returns: This function will return 1 if successful, or -1 if there is no extra weather ID with the specified type.

member.name: M:SampSharp.UndergroundMP.UGMP.ToggleSASunPositionFormula(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables or disables the stock GTA:SA way of calculating the position of the sun in the sky for all connected players. This does not affect the distance from the player at which the sun is placed. If you disable the GTA:SA sun position formula, the game will switch to the GTA:III formula, which is used by all other 3D era games, including Bully. Useful if you want to make a cutscene at Salvatore's Gentlemans Club in the morning but with the sun behind the building.
member.param: 1 to enable, and 0 to disable. Enabled for all players by default.

member.name: M:SampSharp.UndergroundMP.UGMP.SetPlayerKnockedOffBikeState(SampSharp.GameMode.World.BasePlayer,System.Int32)
member.summary: This native can be used to make sure a player does not fall off a bike, which may be very useful during cutscenes.
member.param: The player.

The 'behavior type' which should be set for this player. This parameter can be one of the following values:BIKE_KNOCK_OFF_DEFAULT - The player can be knocked off a bike by crashing, or whatever. The difference between BIKE_KNOCK_OFF_ALWAYS and BIKE_KNOCK_OFF_DEFAULT is that with the default value used mission peds aren't knocked off their bike as often, but with BIKE_KNOCK_OFF_ALWAYS mission peds can be knocked off their bike just as easily as normal peds.BIKE_KNOCK_OFF_NEVER - Never allow a player to be knocked off a bike, even when crashing into a wall at full speed.BIKE_KNOCK_OFF_ALWAYS - See the description for BIKE_KNOCK_OFF_DEFAULT

member.param: The player.
Use one of the following types:SEASON_DONT_OVERRIDE - Disables the season override. The game will switch back to its internal season when used.SEASON_SUMMERSEASON_AUTUMNSEASON_WINTERSEASON_SPRING

member.name: M:SampSharp.UndergroundMP.UGMP.ToggleSASunPositionFormula_Pl(SampSharp.GameMode.World.BasePlayer,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables or disables the stock GTA:SA way of calculating the position of the sun in the sky for one connected player. This does not affect the distance from the player at which the sun is placed. If you disable the GTA:SA sun position formula, the game will switch to the GTA:III formula, which is used by all other 3D era games, including Bully. Useful if you want to make a cutscene at Salvatore's Gentlemans Club in the morning but with the sun behind the building.
member.param: The player.
1 to enable, and 0 to disable. Enabled for all players by default.

The vehicle class to use for this vehicle. This is used a lot under-the-hood as a means to better categorize vehicles.
The spawn frequency for this vehicle. This parameter only applies for NPC traffic, and thus isn't relevant on UG-MP. The value must be between 0 and 10.

member.name: M:SampSharp.UndergroundMP.UGMP.ApplyMapOffsetToCoords(System.Int32,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Applies the offset coordinates of an in-game map area to the input coords. This is useful if you want to ensure that your positions are always relative to the center of a map area (such as Vice City). If we ever decided to move maps around, updating your coords should no longer be necessary.
member.param: The map offset type applied to the input coordinates. This can be one of the following values:MAPOFFSET_MIAMI - As of Snapshot 3.4, this will apply an offset of 7500.0, -7500.0, -5.0 to the input coordinates.MAPOFFSET_NEWYORK - As of Snapshot 3.4, this will apply an offset of 8250.0 8250.0 0.0 to the input coordinates.MAPOFFSET_NEWENGLAND - As of Snapshot 3.4, this will apply an offset of 8250.0 14250.0 0.0 to the input coordinates.
The input X coordinate, passed as reference.
The input Y coordinate, passed as reference.
The input Z coordinate, passed as reference.

member.name: M:SampSharp.UndergroundMP.UGMP.UGMPInternal.CreateExtraWeather(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates an additional weather type for all players.
member.param: This parameter tells the game to interpret the data you pass for this weather type as GTA: III weather data, for example. This means you can load timecyc.dat mods made for GTA: III, GTA: VC, Bully, and GTA: SA. See this page for a list of weather handling types.
This parameter tells the game which 'type' of weather this is. See this page for a list of weather base types.

This parameter tells the game which postfx should be used. All 3d era games have their own postfx which uses the weather data you provide. If you want to use GTA: VCS postfx, you can set this parameter to COLOURFILTER_LEEDS and weatherHandlingType to WEATHER_HANDLING_GTAVCS. One important thing to note in this case is that GTA: VCS has two postfx effects (radiosity and blur) while GTA: LCS only uses blur. See this page for a list of colour filters.
member.returns: The extra weather ID. If you wish to use this weather type, add 150 to the extra weather ID when calling SetWeather. If there are no free slots for a new weather type, this function will return -1.

member.summary: Sets the windyness for an extra weather type.
member.param: The extra weather ID which was obtained when calling CreateExtraWeather.

The windyness for this weather type. The in-game wind will affect procedural vegetation, tree branch movement, wave height, how the Chinatown banners move, and a lot more. The value really knows no limit. 0.0 means no wind, while 2.0 is used for hurricane weather types. In singleplayer, this column is defined in weather.dat.
member.returns: This function will return 1 if successful, or -1 if there is no extra weather ID with the specified type.

member.name: M:SampSharp.UndergroundMP.UGMP.UGMPInternal.SetPlayerKnockedOffBikeState(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: This native can be used to make sure a player does not fall off a bike, which may be very useful during cutscenes.
member.param: The player ID.

The 'behavior type' which should be set for this player. This parameter can be one of the following values:BIKE_KNOCK_OFF_DEFAULT - The player can be knocked off a bike by crashing, or whatever. The difference between BIKE_KNOCK_OFF_ALWAYS and BIKE_KNOCK_OFF_DEFAULT is that with the default value used mission peds aren't knocked off their bike as often, but with BIKE_KNOCK_OFF_ALWAYS mission peds can be knocked off their bike just as easily as normal peds.BIKE_KNOCK_OFF_NEVER - Never allow a player to be knocked off a bike, even when crashing into a wall at full speed.BIKE_KNOCK_OFF_ALWAYS - See the description for BIKE_KNOCK_OFF_DEFAULT

member.name: M:SampSharp.UndergroundMP.UGMP.UGMPInternal.ApplyMapOffsetToCoords(System.Int32,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Applies the offset coordinates of an in-game map area to the input coords. This is useful if you want to ensure that your positions are always relative to the center of a map area (such as Vice City). If we ever decided to move maps around, updating your coords should no longer be necessary.
member.param: The map offset type applied to the input coordinates. This can be one of the following values:MAPOFFSET_MIAMI - As of Snapshot 3.4, this will apply an offset of 7500.0, -7500.0, -5.0 to the input coordinates.MAPOFFSET_NEWYORK - As of Snapshot 3.4, this will apply an offset of 8250.0 8250.0 0.0 to the input coordinates.MAPOFFSET_NEWENGLAND - As of Snapshot 3.4, this will apply an offset of 8250.0 14250.0 0.0 to the input coordinates.
The input X coordinate, passed as reference.
The input Y coordinate, passed as reference.
The input Z coordinate, passed as reference.
